item.title: How a power outage in Colorado caused U.S. official time be 4.8 microseconds off
item.description: Officials said the error is likely be too minute for the general public to clock it, but it could affect applications such as critical infrastructure, telecommunications and GPS signals.

item.description: Researchers retrieved reef monitoring devices that had been placed in deep coral reefs in Guam. The devices were placed up to 330 feet below the surface.

item.title: Shopping for pricy ACA health plans? Some cheaper options come with trade-offs
item.description: Without a fix from Congress, costs for many people who buy health care on the Affordable Care Act marketplace have gone up. Here's what's to know about cheaper choices — and pitfalls to be aware of.

item.title: Cartagena's iconic horse carriages give way to electric buggies
item.description: Cartagena, Colombia, is set to ban its iconic horse-drawn carriages, replacing them with electric buggies — a move dividing the historic city over tradition, tourism, and animal welfare.

item.title: On winter's coldest days, this classic Kashmiri coat offers warmth — and wisdom
item.description: In Kashmir, December 21 is said to mark the start of the 40 harshest days of winter. A woolen robe called a pheran is key to keeping warm — and a reminder of how to face and overcome hardships.

item.title: 9 killed, 10 wounded in South African pub shooting
item.description: Authorities report that nine people have died and at least 10 others are injured after a shooting at a South African pub. The incident occurred early Sunday in Bekkersdal, west of Johannesburg.

item.title: 'Congress is in a coma.' Former lawmakers sound alarm on health of the House
item.description: Congress is wrapping up the year without a lot of legislative accomplishments under its belt and a growing list of lawmakers who are retiring. Former members say the challenges on Capitol Hill have been brewing for a long time.
